xxl.applications.indexStructures
Class RTreeTest

java.lang.Object
  xxl.applications.indexStructures.RTreeTest

public class RTreeTest
extends Object

Creates a flexible, disk resident R*-Tree, linear R-Tree, quadratic R-Tree, Greenes R-Tree or X-Tree and performs exact match and range queries on it. Furthermore, a detailed performance evaluation is implemented, so the time for building and filling the complete tree, as well as IO operations to external memory and buffers, as the time for the different query evaluations is determined.

Data: The R-Tree indexes 10000 entries of key-pointer elements, a tuple containing a multi dimensional rectangle (key) and a pointer, which are extracted from the dataset rr_small.bin lying in the directory xxl\data. rr_small.bin contains a sample of minimal bounding rectangles (mbr) from railroads in Los Angeles, i.e., the entries are of type KPE. Another dataset, called st_small.bin, located in the same directory, is used for query evaluation. It also contains KPE objects, but they represent mbr's of streets.

Insertion: Elements delivered by an input cursor iterating over the external dataset rr_small.bin can be inserted into the tree using two different strategies:

  • tuple insertion : each element of the input cursor is inserted separately
  • bulk insertion : quantities of elements are inserted at once
When using sort-based bulk insertion the user is able to choose different compare modes: given order, by x-axis, by peano-value or by hilbert-value.

Queries:

  • range queries:
    range queries are performed, taking KPEs from st_small.bin. These rectangles represent descriptors. The descriptors are used for the query at any specified target level in the tree.
  • nearest neighbor queries:
    A nearest neighbor query is also executed. Therefore the first rectangle from st_small.bin is used as a query object, to which the ten nearest neighbors are determined. For this realization a priority queue (dynamic heap) based on a special comparator defining an order on the distances of rectangles to the query object is made use of.

To get all valid parameters, please call xxl xxl.applications.indexStructures.RTreeTest help.

Example usage: 

        xxl xxl.applications.indexStructures.RTreeTest minCap=10 maxCap=25 insertType=bulk_hilbert showData

See Also:
Iterator, Comparator, Container, Function, RTree, LinearRTree, QuadraticRTree, GreenesRTree, XTree, ORTree, Tree, Convertable, FileInputCursor, LRUBuffer, KPE, Rectangles

RTreeTest

Method Detail

getReturnRSMD

public static ResultSetMetaData getReturnRSMD()
Part of the @link{TestFramework} which returns the relational metadata to the meassured values of a test run. These test values are stored inside a @link{TestFramework.list}.

Returns:
Here, the following values are meassured and the appropriate relational meta data is returned: TimeForInsertion, TreeHeight, CheckDescriptor, OverAndUnderflows, RangeQueryTime, RangeQueryHits, NearestNeighborTime, RootRangeQueryResults, RemoveTime.

getTestValues

public static Iterator getTestValues(String fieldName)
Part of the @link{TestFramework} which has to produces test values for a variable declared above in this class.

Parameters:
fieldName - Name of a variable from above for which test values are wanted.
Returns:
An Iterator containing appropriate test values.

getDistanceBasedComparator

public static Comparator getDistanceBasedComparator(KPE queryObject)
Returns a comparator which evaluates the distance of two candidate objects to the specified queryObject. This comparator is used for nearest neighbor queries and defines an order on candidate- descriptors. With the help of a priority queue (Min-heap) and this comparator the nearest neighbor query can be performed.

Parameters:
queryObject - a KPE to which the nearest neighbors should be determined
Returns:
a comparator defining an order on candidate objects
